alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued September 30 at 6:18PM MST until September 30 at 7:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 715 PM MST. * At 618 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 9 miles southwest of Kearny to near Florence to near Randolph to near Arizona City, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 173 and 204. AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 159 and 178. US Highway 60 between mile markers 210 and 216. Locations impacted include... Casa Grande, Florence, Coolidge, Queen Creek, Arizona City, La Palma, San Tan Valley, Seville, Florence Junction, Bapchule, Olberg, Arizola, San Tan Mountain Park, Randolph and Blackwater. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
